lines: Sorry, you're still too young for this experience.  Come back later.
Sorry, you're too old for this experience.
In an attempt to win the heart of your latest love, you decide to write her a poem that will melt her very soul. You labor for hours, and then reveal to her the product of your endeavor. Ah, hem...
I'd love to pick some flowers...
And place them in your chestnut hair.
A bit corny, but she loves it--you romantic fool!
And place them on your rear...OOPS! That's not it! You slipped.
It was supposed to be "And place them in your chestnut hair." You must have had romance in your pants, instead of in your heart. You get the old heave-ho!
